text: Eric Abetz says he has faith the Morrison government’s religious discrimination bill will come to an “acceptable” and “proportionate” agreement. “These are difficult issues to grapple with to ensure we get the balance right,” he told Sky News. “The issues that need to be negotiated are still being negotiated. “I’m sure we as a government will come to a landing that is acceptable, proportionate, and will provide the guarantees that were promised to us during the same sex marriage debate.” The draft bill - which would make it unlawful to discriminate against someone on the basis of their religion - has already drawn criticism from religious groups. The bill is set to be discussed in parliament in the next sitting week.
